intro: Hybanthus monopetalus var. normalis, commonly known as the single-petaled hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers with a single, prominent petal. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with erect stems and opposite leaves. Its flowers are often visited by insects, contributing to its role in pollination networks. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral appearance.
